website_summaries.verdict: Latex coating makes these Kevlar gloves puncture resistant across the palms and fingers. Just be aware they are a bit bulky on the hand.
pros: Made of 100% DuPont Kevlar cut-resistant fiber.Coated with blue latex on palm, fingertips, and thumb
Offers tensile strength and cut puncture protection
Great for cutting work and glass handling
Kevlar provides cut and slash resistance
Latex protects palms from punctures and abrasions
Great for industrial work where you need both safety and a good grip
cons: Bulky enough to make precision tasks awkward
Not as much protection on the top of the hand

customer_reviews.title: Very limited protection for knife cuts to the back of the hand.
customer_reviews.text: The gloves appear to be kevlar on the bottom side only. The top cuts easily as the first picture shows. (Is the top cotton???) The bottom is indeed a bit tougher and takes more than one stroke of the knife to cut through it. The top cuts through easily with only one stroke. Do not count on this saving your fingers from a cut that starts at the back of your hand. The second issue is that the rubber deteriorates quickly if you get meat juices on it. Washing them even in warm (not hot) water causes the rubber to transfer to your clothes as the second picture shows.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfgang Rupprecht

customer_reviews.title: Seem like egular work/garden gloves.
customer_reviews.text: These just arrived, so disappointed. Unless the seller can prove these are Kevlar, I agree with others: these are work/gardening gloves you can buy by the dozen pair, single pair etc at big box hardware stores like the big orange store or the big blue one, for much less noney. I don’t recall those being characterized as having Kevlar. Zero way I risk my fingers using a mandolin or other sharp kitchen tools with these. I will keep these if someone can tell me how to determine they’re made of Kevlar, w/o ruining these and preventing their return/refund. Otherwise, I’m tired of all the sellers selling things that aren’t what they say. That’s my concern here.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality. Can't really say they work because I ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. Can't really say they work because I haven't had a slip with the knife. I have taken a razor knife and tested them without my hand inside, made several swipes with the razor knife - the knife couldn't cut the glove material. I would think my hands are safe against most cuts by a knife (I hope I never really find out). These gloves are not for tiny or tedious work. The would be great for cutting fish, meat, construction work settings, but not small delicate work.
customer_reviews.author: ED P.

customer_reviews.title: Bought For Emergency Bag in Car
customer_reviews.text: They fit great and seems cut resistant to be sure. This might sound super dumb, but make sure you put them on the correct hands or you will have the yellow mitten part on your palms and that part is not cut resistant at all - live and learn. Just so you can understand the pain went through before this review. The blue part is "cut" resistant not puncture resistant. If you think you are going to grab a super thorny bush on a dare from your brother-in-law and not bleed out, you are mistaken. Use them like they were designed and you will be pleased. Great fit, blue part on palms, use with sharpish metal things, avoid thorns.
customer_reviews.author: Zen

customer_reviews.title: Cut resistant gloves for your projects:
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my wife they are very good gloves she is very happy. I think I'm going to order some for me in large. It's nice to have cut resistant gloves working with chisels and knives. They will be a good addition to my home shop. Sincerely, Rev. Joseph
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: it is very effective after first use
customer_reviews.text: well i work in a kitchen and i have used it for intended purposes as cut gloves and then as work gloves the temperature of the kitchen and cleaning of the gloves have proved to be a fatal protective coating which then turns them into cut gloves with a sticky coating that smearing on anything it touches. minus the coating that melted on to the knit work it would've been 4 stars at least
customer_reviews.author: D'Jay Izak-sims

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for metal detecting because you never know if there is broken glass along with your target. So far I haven't run across any to test the cut resistance, but when I do I will let you know if they worked, or if I died from blood loss. The only thing derogatory I will say is to not listen to those saying that these run small. I did and ordered a large when I normally wear medium, and they are a bit too big.
customer_reviews.author: MSgt Rick

customer_reviews.title: Fit as expected. Latex on grip area a bit ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected. Latex on grip area a bit smelly, but maybe that will go away. Also latex coating makes gloves a bit stiff, and I would guess that after awhile this coating will get sticky and cause fingers of glove to stick together. However, the thick latex coating gives one more confidence that the gloves on the grip side will resist puncture. Using Kevlar gloves gives one more confidence in working with materials that have sharp edges or protuberances.
customer_reviews.author: Crownbach

customer_reviews.title: I should have bought some sooner.
customer_reviews.text: Great to have when using a mandolin. I make a living with my hands so I don't take chances. Definitely better than a trip to the emergency room for stitches. They are comfortable and they do work. They stretch well enough to fit both mine and my wife's hands. The fabric lets air flow so your hands don't get hot. Clean-up is simple with dish washing liquid while still wearing them. These will give me many years of service. However, They DO NOT work as pot holders or protect your hands from steam; they were not designed for that.
customer_reviews.author: Darin

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: Gardening gloves. I use them with the arm protectors. Was surprised that the gloves aren’t protected all around. I still get stuck by thorns. I guess they weren’t meant to protect when I cut stickery plants and I get scratched on the top of my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Linda H.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: These gloves work as advertised. I will be buying another pair for my adult son, so that both of us can be protected when working with sharp edged material such as glass and thin metals. I recommend these gloves to anyone working with sharp edged materials.
customer_reviews.author: Shortstack

customer_reviews.title: Very protective gloves with good resistance to dampness and soiling
customer_reviews.text: I have bought these for years, for myself and as gifts to my loved ones. They are highly cut resistant, and the rubber keeps them from getting soaked through. Contrary to one of the negative reviews, I always use them with my mandoline, and have no concern about cutting myself. I can only imagine that reviewer bought a different glove (there are work gloves that look identical, and I have to be careful to keep them out of my kitchen). I run these gloves through the washer, and found they were coming out tacky. I ran them through the dryer, and that solved the problem -- don't ask me why!
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Great for chainsaw work
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great for operating a chainsaw in hot weather. The rubber grip is excellent for non-slip contact and the Kevlar weave allows your hand to breathe and provides an extra layer of abrasion/cut resistance.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hunicke

customer_reviews.title: For this the gloves work great. The material also makes holding the wet shells ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to shuck oysters and clams. Neither require a sharp knife but the sides of the shell can be sharp. For this the gloves work great. The material also makes holding the wet shells easy. When using a pointed knife while shucking, you should still wasp the palm of your hand with a thick towel. As for size, for a woman I have large hands and long fingers. The medium fits fairly well. Just a tad too large.
customer_reviews.author: DJCTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: "Some" Protection
customer_reviews.text: Don't think bullet proof vest. These offer some protection, especially against accidental edge cutting, but less against stabbing with a sharp point. I wanted to use them for shucking Oysters. If you take a sharp knife and put the point against these gloves you definitely feel it. If you put a folded cotton towel into the gloves and stab them, the point comes through and cuts the towel, but not nearly as much as without the glove. On the other hand they are cheap and flexible, so I would still use them for shucking oysters, as the oyster knife is not as pointy as a kitchen knife.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: The blue grip does not last long.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable. Good grip but grip doesn't hold up long doing warehouse work. The blue grip material started separating after 3 weeks of lifting boxes of product. Had to replace.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: Super duper stinky out of the bag
customer_reviews.text: Had to air them outside for like a week before the smell died down. I was planning on using these for oyster shucking but the smell turned me off so much I never used them for anything. Felt like it was contaminating my food. I bought a pair of 5$ gloves at the oyster farm that were all blue but worked well and were waterproof. I'm still saving these for when I need the cut resistant kevlar material. But I realized I didn't need these for oyster shucking. Now I just use a towel by the way, the gloves are actually cumbersome and not needed for oyster shucking.
customer_reviews.author: Tinybear

customer_reviews.title: Well made gloves.
customer_reviews.text: When using a mandolin, I always use a glove. Better safe than sorry. The glove is a must. I have a pair but only use my left hand and left glove. I hold the mandolin with my right hand, I never grate anything with it. One thing I've noticed is that its difficult to clean the blue part. I use soap and water and it doesn't clean up well. I should find out if I can toss it into the washing machine!
customer_reviews.author: BTD

customer_reviews.title: Surprised.
customer_reviews.text: I was actually surprised. I have several carving gloves but none with the full rubber grip that these have. I found the glove to be comfortable to wear and the full rubber grip allows me to hold the wood and my chisels without slippage. I like that.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey La Salle

customer_reviews.title: Real Hand Saver
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my wife to use while slicing vegies on her new mandoline slicer. While comfortable they do hinder your range of flexibility to some degree so don't plan to be able to "pick up a dime" while wearing them. They do exactly what they were designed for, protect your hands from cuts and abrasions. I'm not sure if they could protect fingers from a direct knife slice and am pretty sure they are not puncture proof but certainly protection from "angle slices" that take off the skin from fingertips. I also used them to pick up large pieces of broken glass and they worked great.
customer_reviews.author: msn

customer_reviews.title: Sea Urchin laughs at "puncture protection"
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for low-visibility jetty scuba diving where red sea urchins are prevelant. The local Sea Urchins laughs at claims of "puncture protection", although they've defeated nearly every glove to date short of the bug hunter gloves that don't last terribly long. Good dexterity, right price, decent.
customer_reviews.author: B. Evans

customer_reviews.title: How they handle...
customer_reviews.text: As far as the protection is concerned, I give these gloves a 5-star rating. Kevlar is very durable and protective. As far as the ethical-usage for kitchen use, they are not as comfortable as another brand that I have used in the past. I usually wear a latex glove over the top of this glove just to prevent stains, but regardless if I wear one or not, they are still slightly stiff when using. I use them everyday and I am happy with the purchase, but I will not purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: WESLEY STEPHENS

customer_reviews.title: Ok with watwr but not with chemicals
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine but the car cleaning chemicals at work have turn the rubber liner into a sticky mess.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Dupont

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Blue coating becomes super sticky over time when exposed to summer heat in garage. So sticky the gloves melt together and stick to other objects.
customer_reviews.author: J. Waite

customer_reviews.title: These are easy to put on
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to shuck oysters, especially if you're not a pro, do yourself a favor and get these gloves and use them. I'm not a pro, but I've worked a raw bar and I know my way around shellfish. I've used the old dish towel method many times, but using these are safer. You may still want to use a dish towel as well if you're at all unsure and don't want to risk an accident. These are easy to put on, easy to use, easy to take off and easy to clean. Give them a try, you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: The DIY Guy

customer_reviews.title: Not good with mandolin use
customer_reviews.text: I have the correct size fitting ones for my hands. After a few uses with these, the mandolin cut into the glove, finger didn't get cut but still the Kevlar didn't hold up. I now use these glovesfor mandolin uses which is said to hold up better to mandolin use than the blue ones. What's a few dollars more to keep your finger tips?
customer_reviews.author: Cris

customer_reviews.title: It's in the written review.
customer_reviews.text: I love it so much I gave it to my best friend that will use it for work the same work I do.
customer_reviews.author: Celeste Lehtomaa

customer_reviews.title: Handy Kitchen Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go with a Progressive Mandolin I bought. Apparently the mandolin's safety features are junk and most recommended Kevlar gloves so as to not cut your hands on the blades. These work wonders for that purpose. I've scuffed these gloves up against those blades a number of time without a scratch on me and the gloves are still in great condition. Granted, I'm sure you don't want to purposefully try and cut these gloves, but they work well for added protection. I recommend them for this purpose!
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: I own a lot of different gloves.  Love these!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves really protect your hands from sharp objects, briars and horned trees. Will buy again for both myself and my wife.
customer_reviews.author: VJC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Protection
customer_reviews.text: I wear these doing yard work, pulling out weeds, stickers, etc. Great protection.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for working with cardboard
customer_reviews.text: Great for handling cardboard boxes, good grip and they protect your hands from drying out and cuticle cracks. They do get a little dirty and stinky after awhile but I have just thrown them in the wash and they seem to come out ok.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Safety for Sharp Implements
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these gloves to go along with a mandoline slicer. I had previously cut myself pretty well and wanted to make sure I didn't repeat. So I found these and ordered them. They are very sturdy and so far they have proven to be perfectly resistant to cuts, even a new and very sharp mandoline blade, so I am very happy with them and am able to use the mandoline with full confidence I won't be missing anything when I am done with my prep work.
customer_reviews.author: SeanDom

customer_reviews.title: They protect my hands but they smell too much like rubber
customer_reviews.text: I have a stained glass class so I deal with a lot of glass and would often cut myself. I purchased this gloves and they work fine they do protect my hands but even after wearing for a minute or less my hands smell like rubber for the rest of the day lol. I try washing my hands several times but the smell stays until the next day that I take a shower. Its not like a big issue for me because the smell doesn't bother me but if you think that might be an issue for you don't buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Karina

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves!!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves we have been using for awhile now and find they are very well made - make using a mandolin much easier as we feel safe holding onto the food instead of the food holder that came with our mandolin. Our fingers with the glove on have come in contact with the blade of the mandolin several times and the glove has not cut or ripped at all!! We got this size for my wife and they fit her hands well and she says that they are comfortable to wear!!
customer_reviews.author: George Benson

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to protect my hands while shucking oysters. They provide good grip on wet items and a solid amount of protection, though it may be wise to use a towel anyway if you're planning on using them for shellfish. My only complaint was that they are advertised as 100% kevlar and the label attached to the gloves only states "made with kevlar" with no notation for content otherwise (hence 4 stars instead of 5). Regaerdless I would recommend these for anyone looking to keep all the flesh on their hands where it is while using sharp/pointy implements.
customer_reviews.author: Nuggets

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves for Gardening and More
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite gloves for gardening and almost anything outside. The mesh backs help the glove to breathe so your hands stay cool and unsweaty. The coating makes it so easy to do the work, and keeps your hands dry and clean. I didn't really need this heavier weight, but they're fine with the extra added layer of protection against sharp objects. (Not gonna try that out anytime soon, I hope.)
customer_reviews.author: It's About Time

customer_reviews.title: I'm Glad They Have Some Stretch To Them
customer_reviews.text: I can squeeze into the Medium size. and they fit like a glove. Love the colors, and the Price is nothing short of Phenomenal.
customer_reviews.author: WVU Alumnus in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Kevlar gloves
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Kevlar gloves with rubberized palm from Amazon. I use these gloves for several things including in my machine shop. They are great for handling sharp hot metal chips. Also the rubberized palm and fingers makes it easy to handle slippery metal parts. Yesterday I had to rake up all the fallen leaves in the yard. A honey-do job. The rake handle had splinters but with these gloves it was no problem. I think they would be good for holding large cheeseburgers too. I will buy more of them soon. Russ Anderson
customer_reviews.author: Russ Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Very rugged gloves
customer_reviews.text: Fits very well. Have not had a chance to try them magnet fishing yet but I'm sure they will do great
customer_reviews.author: REH

customer_reviews.title: These appeared to have the same puncture resistant features at a much better price. Bought 'em for my wife to use ...
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking for a pair of Atlas Kevlar/Rubber gloves, but they are an arm and a leg. These appeared to have the same puncture resistant features at a much better price. Bought 'em for my wife to use gardening. We have tons of unpleasant plants like Greenbriar, Blackberry, and Wild roses that take a tole on hands. The fit is good, and they do the job for a most reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Curmudgeon

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves these & uses as work gloves for many tasks
customer_reviews.text: Always hard to find gloves that actually fit husband. I purchased original pair for working around our dock pilings so he would not cut his hands. However, he has now used these for many tasks. In fact, he told me to order a "spare" pair next time I needed to make freight/$25 minimum from Amazon. He could not believe price was less than $10. They have protected his hands very well from glass, metal filings, etc.
customer_reviews.author: G. Haring

customer_reviews.title: These gloves make for happy fingers.
customer_reviews.text: These have saved my fingers many a time. I use them mostly when operating my mandoline or trying to fillet a fish. The rubbery grip comes in especially handy for the slippery food items. I have small hands, so the medium is a bit too large for me- still, I've never slashed through the tips, as I tend to pay close attention to the blade. These have also come in quite handy for cleaning up broken glass.
customer_reviews.author: Nea

customer_reviews.title: For my fishing tackle box
customer_reviews.text: I got these gloves to wear when the weather gets colder and I go out fishing. I have some trouble with my circulation the older I get. But I find that I wear them all the time, even in Summer. The grip is really helpful for removing fish hooks and avoiding getting cut with fishing line. It also helps keep fish guts and fishy smell off my hands. I just drop them in the washer and let them dry by hand.
customer_reviews.author: M.C.L

customer_reviews.title: kitchen products
customer_reviews.text: I have these obviously for safety when I use my meat slicer. Only used them a few times and haven`t touched the blade with them so can`t swear to effectiveness if that happened. I do know Kevlar though and am inclined to trust them. Accidents will, happen no matter how careful you are. Better safe than sorry. Seems people don`t seem to really miss a digit until they lose one eh? Be safe, not sorry. Nice feel when I wear them also.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hyatt

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Easy to Clean
customer_reviews.text: We got these gloves to use with our Edgecraft Electric Food Slicer and use them all the time in the kitchen now. They clean up very well and fit snugly to the hand. At around ten dollars they are a wonderful deal and have kept our skin safe from nicks and burns. I recommend these gloves to anyone doing heavy duty work in the kitchen and they would work for other activities such as crafts and cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: One Happy Mommy

customer_reviews.title: great fillet gloves
customer_reviews.text: great fit - breathable back - works well when wet on slimy fish - washable - even looks cool
customer_reviews.author: krackshot

customer_reviews.title: small
customer_reviews.text: Small for my hand, XXL it is too small and finger are short
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great with a mandolin
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves after receiving a mandolin for Christmas and hearing all the horror stories about how sharp the blade was. I have big hands and bought a medium gloves to have a snug fit. These gloves work great. No slippage of food when it's wet and I've caught my fingers against the blade while slicing food and so glad I had these gloves on: No cuts, no knicks, and gloves unscathed. So many uses for these gloves now that I own them, so very much worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: V. Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Thank Goodness!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I got these gloves when I decided that I wanted to shuck clams and oysters this summer. I shucked one littleneck clam and one oyster: were it not for these gloves, I would have had an easier time opening the skin on my hands than I did opening those bivalves!! I ended up steaming all of them, but one day I'll watch the videos on YouTube again and attempt this, and maybe even have better luck!!
customer_reviews.author: Dee C.

customer_reviews.title: cut resistant kevlar-not so good
customer_reviews.text: Did not prevent 2 cuts I suffered. It was comfortable, but the next pair I buy to prevent cuts from wood carving will be from a different company
customer_reviews.author: HJ Gnats

customer_reviews.title: Love These Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves! They are waterproof, fit well, and are worth the price I paid. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: oley

customer_reviews.title: Not a very good glove! Worked 5 hrs opening boxes before dots ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a very good glove ! Worked 5 hrs opening boxes before dots started coming off and threads started coming lose. Would not advise spending the money on this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: work
customer_reviews.text: I try not to get the cloth part dirty because I'm not sure how i'll clean them (it may say on the packaging or on a tag, but who looks?), but I have a college-aged daughter who is clumsy and fearless - well, a little less fearless after she almost cut off a chunk of her finger - so I got these to say her digits. They work, they fit well, and they are comfortable. I use them all the time now.
customer_reviews.author: rmepants

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of work gloves for around the house
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for a variety of purposes, most recently in the garden when chopping rose bushes. However, also used them when I was transporting an old stove out of the house. It had some really sharp edges and metal points and the Kevlar grips on these gloves saved my hands from some serious damage. Have had no issues with penetration through the glove as mentioned in other reviews. Then again, have not spent much time shucking oysters!
customer_reviews.author: Mark D. Dimont

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: After my son cut his hand open shucking oysters and had to get to get stitches, I ordered him these gloves as kind of a joke as I have made a trip or two to the ER myself. They were so great, I ordered one pair for me to use in the kitchen and one for my husband to use in his workshop when cutting glass. They are comfortable and easy to work in.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Keyes

customer_reviews.title: Little lose
customer_reviews.text: These are very durable and I use it regularly but they don’t fit as snug as I would like.
customer_reviews.author: Dark Knight

customer_reviews.title: Really love these!
customer_reviews.text: Really love these!! I have been also using them as oven mitts and for gloves for the stove. They fit perfectly and they really do the job well I used to so afraid to try and crack open oysters but now I feel like I can do it without any issues
customer_reviews.author: kips

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: While these gloves will not withstand a direct assault with a meat clever they do hold up to lesser attacks by sharp knives and the pointed dorsal fins of unruly fish you are cleaning. They also prevent a good degree of slippage when handling those fish as well as a good degree of protection while shucking oysters. All and all these gloves preform as expected and are recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: These gloves to work well.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves to work well. I give them a 4 because you can cut through them with a sharp knife and moderately heavy pressure, I tested them. But overall they are fine and comfortable to use. A little on the larger side which is fine unless you need dexterity.
customer_reviews.author: JCF Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Oysters still win.
customer_reviews.text: Better than the last gloves I owned, but still not as good at protecting from puncture wounds
customer_reviews.author: Angelo's Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Strong solvent odor
customer_reviews.text: Purchased four pair on this order of which all came out of their packaging reeking of solvent (mineral spirits). Personnel all complained the odor transfered to their hands after short usage. Washed gloves in hot soapy water (twice) but smell still prevalent. Will not purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: G. Erickson

customer_reviews.title: comfortable
customer_reviews.text: So far the knife has not slipped, so I'm not sure if the glove will do the job they are designed to do and I'm hoping I will never have to put them to their true test. They feel comfortable grasping an oyster, non slip and no punctures by the sharp edges of the oyster...so far I'm pleased with them, but I do feel the one glove is wasted since I don't wear one on the hand that I hold the knife with...no need.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: It works but not commercial quality. The blue coating is coming off.
customer_reviews.author: lokelani 2

customer_reviews.title: It protects, yeeh!!
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't what I expected but it does the job. I bought them for my husband. We do a lot of fishing and he is the one who cleans our catch. He was always cutting his finger. So to prevent him from losing a finger, I bought these. At first he said they were kind of tight, but now that he has broken them in, he loves them. So yes I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great protection
customer_reviews.text: A great fit and well made. Will have been using to protect my hands from hazards while magnet fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Steve C

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The threadcount is really low. It does offer some protection, but I'm going to be looking for something better
customer_reviews.author: Woodcement

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Earthquake kit. They are for sharp long edges. A needle or pointy shard will go right through the weave. But for picking up broken plate glass for example or sheet metal, these are fine. Double them up with tough leather gloves after the earthquake.
customer_reviews.author: Hank Roberts

customer_reviews.title: A must have for Oysters!...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my monthly oyster cravings....glad I did. These guard against cuts and scrapes that ALWAYS a happen if you don't use gloves. Believe me, not a fun experieince with sharp shell edges! These gloves are great. Solid traction and super protection without sacrificing feel. Plus they are a great price so if you like oysters and doing it yourself, then these are a must.
customer_reviews.author: Renegade AGGRSSR

customer_reviews.title: Dog handling
customer_reviews.text: I use this to handle my vicious miniature dachshund and the bites are barely noticeable. Will buy again
customer_reviews.author: Citizen slyder

customer_reviews.title: Used for Oyster Shucking
customer_reviews.text: For oyster shucking, these gloves are excellent. There were a couple of times that, had I not been wearing these gloves, I would have stabbed myself in the hand. Understand, however, that oyster knives have, generally, a dull blade. I'm pretty sure that if I would have stabbed myself with a sharp steak knife, it would have pierced right through the glove.
customer_reviews.author: Trousered Ape

customer_reviews.title: I was impressed by these. More durable and longer lasting and gloves that cost more money.
customer_reviews.text: Like the price. Was Amazed that they outperformedand gloves I paid more money for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They fit like a large compared to my other gloves of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the XL size. They fit like a large compared to my other gloves of the same kind but a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: sean n

customer_reviews.title: A glove for many uses
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these gloves to help in shucking oysters. I discovered another good use for them, however. A picture frame fell from the wall and had many shards of glass which were easily cleaned up with the use of these gloves.They completely protected my hands from the glass. I am sure I can find many more uses for them, also.
customer_reviews.author: Lawyer/prof

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves Great value
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. When I have a lot of shucking to do or fish to clean theses keep my hands from getting shredded and cut up. Really comfortable to wear for long periods if needed. Very durable and a great value. I would recommend getting a couple apirs for any kitchen and would make a good stocking stuffer for chefs.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan G Migita

customer_reviews.title: Kevlar Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I was in need of a pair of pretty decent cut resistant gloves for general work and woodworking and carving. These are just fine. They are a good price. Blades don't seem to hurt them. I will be putting them through light to medium work and expect them to last and perform. It is nice to see they are washable, though I doubt they will ever leave the work area. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: James Killgo

customer_reviews.title: good fit but not at all puncture resistant
customer_reviews.text: I used these gloves to pull bramble weed from my garden. Not sure what the botanical term is but they are small vines with thorns. The glove did nothing to prevent the thorns from coming right through. I thought they might work for shucking oysters but I'm scared to try now. They fit well with long fingers, unlike a lot of gloves from Asia that are made with very short fingers.
customer_reviews.author: T. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good product
customer_reviews.text: I like these slighty better than the cut resistant Wells Lamont 551 gloves that I also purchased here on Amazon. The latex coating stays on these better than the Nitrile coating stays on the Wells Lamont gloves. But both coating on both gloves do start to peel off after heavy use. Cut resistance on both gloves is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W. Zewe

customer_reviews.title: I hope I never need them
customer_reviews.text: They look like they would save a finger or two . I have had Kevlar gloves for different reasons for years. I hope I never get the chance to write a raving review about how these gloves saved me from cutting fingers off. I will use them when I cut stuff with my new slicer, I will also put them on whenever I am doing something where I think , at my old age , I might hurt myself , chain saw , knife , whatever. Safety is pretty cheap , Doctor visits are not AND they hurt. Work and cook safe.
customer_reviews.author: Jack strickland

customer_reviews.title: Bought these for son after he was impaled with fish spine
customer_reviews.text: My son wears these at work, as they are better than those provided. They appear to be pretty puncture proof when you are dealing with fish. His old gloves were not, and he had to have surgery to remove a red snapper spine. He's not too worried about repeat performance with these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: S. Jones

customer_reviews.title: These do the job, however they are way overpriced ...
customer_reviews.text: These do the job, however they are way overpriced. I saw a similar pair at my local supermarket for less than $4.
customer_reviews.author: NKA

customer_reviews.title: Can still feel hedgehog pricks through gloves
customer_reviews.text: Hedgehog quills can be felt while wearing these! Spend a little more for a better pair
customer_reviews.author: Luscious775

customer_reviews.title: Good Solution for Hand Protection
customer_reviews.text: As a novice oyster-shucker I wanted some protection for my left hand (I'm a righty) and this product has served well. Undoubtedly, it won't provide the protection of a chain-mail glove but it's a fraction of the cost and has already saved me from a penetrating injury . . . for which I am most grateful. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Walter H.

customer_reviews.title: Protected me from thornbush
customer_reviews.text: Used these when I was trimming a thornbush and was protected for the most part. The large thorns still penetrated the gloves (as expected). I also use these for pulling weeds. Very durable set of gardening gloves.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Remember 'dip' from Who Framed Roger Rabbit??
customer_reviews.text: It looks like someone wove these gloves together and then put them on and dipped their hand, palm-first, into a big vat of DIP. However, that doesn't effect their usage. The worked great and dexterity is good (given that they are cut resistant). I just thought the dip thing was funny.
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for handling Maryland Blue Crabs
customer_reviews.text: I specifically bought these to handle live Maryland Blue Crabs - I like to steam them myself. The gloves worked great. The crabs clasped hard with their claws, but I didn't feel a thing. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Devereaux

customer_reviews.title: Indispensable.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are a must have if you use the mandolin grater. They lasted though ~ 10 uses. After that I swapped them, wear the left glove on the right hand and got some more use from them. I also use them when chopping with my great knives that will cut your fingers off if you blink.
customer_reviews.author: YELENA SHABANOVA

customer_reviews.title: G&F 1620L cut resistant gloves
customer_reviews.text: Well made I feel more comfortable handling glass these gloves provide a good grip.
customer_reviews.author: ed branom,jr

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves If You're Tired of Cutting Your Fingers and Hands
customer_reviews.text: My work involves handling electronic components and circuit boards which can cause near razor-like cuts. I decided I needed some protective gloves and did quite a bit of research before settling on these. No more cuts and the rubberized finger tips provide a nice working grip. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: AmazinRon

customer_reviews.title: Really Tough Yet Flexible Workgloves
customer_reviews.text: Most workgloves are not very flexible or if they are than they are not tough at all. This one is made from a special material, which is flexible, breathes but at the same time is flexible. If one is working with potentially hazardous materials or power equipment, saws, paint sprayers, etc., this is a great value in an insurance policy of sorts. This is an excellent product at a most reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: eva & tom

customer_reviews.title: They really work!
customer_reviews.text: I use these when I'm cutting wire to build rabbit cages, after years of ruining cloves and getting cut through gloves. I've only used them once so far, but I didn't get a single scratch on my hands, so I would definitely say they work! I'm usually pretty cut up, even if I was wearing gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves, but...
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves, but... You'll need to wash these out several times to remove the sticky residue left over from the manufacturing. After a day of work in these, you're hands feel like you've dipped them in contact cement. Otherwise; fit, finish, and price are all great.
customer_reviews.author: Old Hacker

customer_reviews.title: Essential item to have around the house
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought this glove for my yard needs. It came in handy when carrying branches that have thorns. Since the gloves are knitted, it is very flexible. I bought this in size L because my husband can also wear it when he shucks the oysters. Even though it's big on me (I wear size S), I have no problem grabbing things. Great item to have around the house!
customer_reviews.author: AvgMom2

customer_reviews.title: I was an NCO and later dealt with union officials ...
customer_reviews.text: I was an NCO and later dealt with union officials in grievance procedures, so I have an expanded vocabulary, all of which I used after cutting my finger on my Benriner slicer. NOW I use this glove EVERY time I even get close to that sneaky little monster. I do not use the food holder because this Kevlar glove protects me no matter what direction I come at the blade. Inexpensive protection against a slippery grip and stupidity.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Rapp

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I handle and cut glass a lot. Have not cut myself anymore by wearing these
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: My second pair
customer_reviews.text: Use it for slicing on a mandolin. Feels comfortable and safe
customer_reviews.author: MarcyAbu

customer_reviews.title: One too many microplane injury?  These are just the thing.
customer_reviews.text: I was worried these would be bulky and awkward for fine tasks like grating ginger and zesting lemons, but they actually weren't too bad. I'm a woman with fairly long fingers and the medium just about fits. I might try a large if I had to order another pair someday, though.
customer_reviews.author: BSC

customer_reviews.title: The sizing on these are pretty accurate, perhaps a 1/2 size smaller
customer_reviews.text: The sizing on these are pretty accurate, perhaps a 1/2 size smaller, but being a stretch fit the sizing is acceptable. The blue rubber coating has good grip. UPDATE: The blue grip started to delaminate after about 9-12 months of hard use, which is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: aTypicalEngineer808

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for ropes type challenge courses.
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable, well made, and durable. I used them for a ropes course that requires gloves. It has amazing grip as the Kevlar portion is very grippy and didn't wear down from three hours of holding onto steel suspension and safety lines.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves - see tip
customer_reviews.text: Great for cutting. Tip - they are wonderful for opening jars because they give a much better grip. I gave my mother a pair and she loves them for this use.
customer_reviews.author: L. Balsam

customer_reviews.title: Smells
customer_reviews.text: This was a large size and my hands are small. It does feel like it will the job of protecting your hands but the chemical smell on it is so strong, I do not want to use this while preparing my food. Ill just keep it, maybe it will come in handy for something else. :(
customer_reviews.author: bmhgem1

product_meta.title: G & F Products G & F 1607XL Cut Resistant Work Gloves, 100-Percent Kevlar Knit Work Gloves, Make by DuPont Kevlar, Protective Gloves to Secure Your hands from Scrapes, Cuts in Kitchen, Wood Carving, Carpentry and De, X-Large
product_meta.description:
Size:X-LargeMade of 100 Percent DuPont Kevlar Cut Resistant Fiber. Coated with Blue latex on a palm, fingertips, and thumb. 1 Pair, XLarge

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Made of 100 Percent DuPont Kevlar Cut Resistant Fiber which provides excellent cut and slash resistance. The Textured latex coated palm provides sure grip, protects from punctures and abrasions
feature_bullets: Made of 100 Percent DuPont Kevlar Cut Resistant Fiber
Coated with Blue latex on palm, fingertips, and thumb
Tensile strength, cut and puncture protection
perfect for Cutting Work and glass handling
